page.title: 11 Industry
page.content: Whitstable Harbour lies at the mouth of the River Swale and the River Thames. Latitude 51'21'N Longitude 1'02'Z.It opened on 19th March, 1832, & a railway ran from it to Canterbury until 1952. In 1958, the local council purchased it from British Transport Commission in 1958. The main imports are stone,slag, seadredged ballast, grain,timber,fertilizers,confectionery and general cargo.Exports include steel,cereals,aggregates,durite and general cargo. The harbour covers an area of 14 acres; 1.5 acres = harbour basin; 2.5 acres foreshore; 10 acres = land,quays,transit sheds,warehouses and storage sheds. It is tidal and capable of accepting vessels up to 1000 tonnes. Oysters,fishing and shell fishing provide employment for about 40 people. It is also used for yachting and water skiing.
